item.title: My mother-in-law, 95, has $400K in stocks. Would it be smarter taxwise to gift it to her kids — or leave it to them in her will?
item.description: “What is the smartest way to go about this? Will she be taxed?”

item.title: Israel-Iran conflict poses three challenges for stocks that could slam market by up to 20%, warns RBC
item.description: Spiking oil prices may muddle the Federal Reserve’s inflation forecasts

item.title: There-is-no-alternative gets a revival as U.S. households snap up stocks
item.description: Goldman Sachs expects $425 billion of household buying of U.S. stocks this year.

item.title: Seattle Seahawks linebacker Ernest Jones IV sells his L.A. home for $1.8 million
item.description: Ernest Jones IV has officially quit California, less than a year after he was traded from the L.A. Rams to the Tennessee Titans and finally to the Sea...

item.title: Lizzo is still trying to sell her Beverly Hills home, now for $2 million less than she paid for it
item.description: Pop sensation Lizzo purchased the dazzling home from Harry Styles in 2022 for $15 million, and listed it last December for $16 million.
